A must have for any party, this bard has got all that's needed: 16th lvl Bard/Curse Song, Lingering Song and Craft Wand on the bard's side and battle prowess and versatility on the fighter side.

This guy is not just gonna hide singing in a corner, but can take the heat of battle smashing skulls, sewering heads and maiming left and right with great delight (look, it rhymes! it must be the secret bard in me ). Jokes apart, this guy has got the necessary fighting skills to fight actively with his party.

posts.author: Grimnir
posts.content:
Bards are by many people only used for skilldumps, and is often considered a weak class.

So I really like tha fact that this bard-heavy build outperforms your DragonScion and DragonSpawn build in almost every way. Only thing I spot off the bat is their fortsaves and their hitpoints. And that is by Bard-/cursesong alone. Count the bardbuffs from spells and they're not even close.

If you get your performance points elsewhere, I'd like Still Spell, Expertise and perhaps Extend Spell. At least those are what I think would be the top three missing feats. I know you have craft wand to compensate, but Still/extended would let you use your 6th lvl slots as it is.

posts.author: magaiti
posts.content:
I may be stating the obvious, and maybe you'll consider my changes a wholly different build, but anyway.

- Saves can be helped by going (Bard 16 / Fighter 2 / BG 2)
You will obviously have to ditch WS, and 2 other feats, in order to get PA & Cleave.
Luckily, there is a lot of feats to choose from: Lingering Song, Artist, Weapon Focus, Improved Critical: Scimitar, Toughness, Skill Focus: Perform, Craft Wand.

- Damage output can be helped by further going to (Bard 16 / Fighter 1 / BG 3), and taking Divine Might.
You will have to lose 2 more feats though.


- Still spell would help greatly, too. Think of Greater Dispelling, War Cry, Haste, Fear, Confusion. Tasha's or Balagarn for some PvP cheese.

- Interesting choice would be to go DEX (not recommended without Divine Might due to miserable damage output).
Take Finesse instead of Still Spell, use rapier / bow. Only need to remove shield to cast during combat (War Cry, Greater Dispelling), or use light shield and accept the 5% spell failure.
Not having Uncanny Dodge sucks though.

Artist and SF: Perform are the most obvious candidates here since some perform enhancing gear is generally available. Besides, PA and Cleave are in themselves good feats to have.

A possibility, but I'd say only if Cha will be maxed out easily and not at the expenses of Str (because of mix matching equipment).
- Still spell would help greatly, too. Think of Greater Dispelling, War Cry, Haste, Fear, Confusion. Tasha's or Balagarn for some PvP cheese.
Craft wand partially covers that issue (and more), but aye, Still spell is a good option too.
- Interesting choice would be to go DEX (not recommended without Divine Might due to miserable damage output).
Take Finesse instead of Still Spell, use rapier / bow. Only need to remove shield to cast during combat (War Cry, Greater Dispelling), or use light shield and accept the 5% spell failure.
Not having Uncanny Dodge sucks though.
Dex builds are generally at a disadvantage in a lvl 20 environment. In this case, I would stick with Str.

Thank you for your ideas!

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Ooh, lots to unpack here Wei Tu Fat (loving the name, btw)!

I'm afraid Kail has been otherwise engaged (we hope) for the last few years, so the rest of us will have to do in his absence.

As far as Bardic knowledge goes (excuse the pun), have a look at Mick's Bard Guide - which is about as comprehensive a guide to the class as you'll find anywhere.

I wouldn't worry about dropping Craft Wand unless you're playing on World of Greyhawk (WoG), where it's very useful, or a similar environment.

Also, your combat Bard will be better off thinking about buffing and singing than casting - they'll always be susceptible to dispels from "proper" casters - so yes, buff and don armour, then get singing.

As far as Set Trap goes, check Hip's Guide to Trapping. For a level 20 build you won't be able to set epic traps in any case, though if you're interested in having the skill you'll need 13 modified ranks to max it - assuming you also take a modified 5 ranks in Disable Trap (which is cross-classed for Bard, so takes twice the points) - or 15 without the synergy.

The AB and AC stuff you mention will either have to wait for a further post or for someone else posting about it.

Hope this helps for now!

Cheers
